intro: Newberrya pumila, commonly known as the dwarf nettle or rock nettle, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Urticaceae family, which includes many species of nettles. The plant has small, heart-shaped leaves with fine hairs that can cause skin irritation upon contact. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Newberrya pumila is known for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it a hardy and resilient plant.
